text: * Pre-pruning involve Early Stopping Criteria — simple approaches e.g. n < some threshold; IG < some threshold (critical value pruning); tree depth > some threshold; — statistical significance tests, e.g. pruning. — Computationally efficient but can miss interactions between features that emerge within subtrees. * Post-pruning involves growing tree to completion and then checking each branch for tuning — recommended approach is to compare the error rat when subtree is included and excluded on an T s independent validation set. < DuBL
